pageContext.claim: “As you know, we've done tremendous things having to do with the individual mandate. We got rid of the individual mandate from Obamacare. Which really ended Obamacare as it would be officially known, because the individual mandate was the biggest part.”
pageContext.analysis: This is simply false. The Affordable Care Act expanded Medicaid enrollment in many states by millions of people, established new health insurance marketplaces online, provided subsidies to buyers, and guaranteed coverage for patients with preexisting conditions, among a raft of other changes that remain intact.
